31.heading: BIOGRAPHICAL COMIC BOOKS, STRIPS, ETC.
31.title: Lily Renée, Escape Artist : From Holocaust Survivor to Comic Book Pioneer
31.author: Trina Robbins ; illustrated by Anne Timmons and Mo Oh.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Presents the story of Lily Renée Wilheim, the Jewish girl who escaped from the Nazis through the Kindertransport operation, leaving her parents behind and traveling alone to England, later becoming a comic book artist in New York.

32.heading: BIOGRAPHICAL COMIC BOOKS, STRIPS, ETC.
32.title: Logicomix : an Epic Search for Truth
32.author: Apostolos Doxiadis, Christos H
notes: Summary (from OCLC): This innovative, dramatic graphic novel recounts the spiritual odyssey of philosopher Bertrand Russell. In his agonized search for absolute truth, Russell crosses paths with legendary thinkers and finds a passionate student in the great Ludwig Wittgenstein.

114.heading: BIOGRAPHICAL COMIC BOOKS, STRIPS, ETC.
114.title: White Devil : the Life and Legend of Hudson Taylor
114.author: Tien Dao ; translated from the Chinese edition by K
114.appears_in: Meikle with Jan Greenough ; compiled and illustrated by Philadelphia.
notes: "J. Hudson Taylor sails for China in 1853 at the age of 21. The journey takes five months. Dressing like the Chinese and learning their language, he starts to teach about Jesus. 'Bai Gui!' they shout at him. White Devil! Their hatred is clear. Steeped in the cultural traditions of ancestor worship and idolatry, the Chinese want nothing more than for this Westerner to leave. Criticised by English and Chinese alike and able to trust on-one, Hudson Taylor faces treacherous boat trips, terrifying nights on the street, poverty and even death. But one thing he knows: his God is trustworthy."

119.author: Nicolas Dessaux
119.appears_in: p. 52-55 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 6 (Jan. 2001).
notes: Begins: "Cette brève étude se donne pour objet d'esquisser l'analyse du choix des figures et du traitement historique des biographies de femmes illustres publiées sous formes de bandes dessinées dans la presse française à l'usage des jeunes filles dans la période 1945-1975, c'est-à-dire de la Libération à la raréfaction des titres non mixtes."

English summary (from p. 150): "Portraits of Women. Many complete illustrated stories based on historical figures appeared in French girls' weeklies. Nicolas Dessaux shows how these characters from the Bible, the Revolution, the Resistance or the world of sport, presented as role models for the young readers, differed according to publication and period."

120.heading: Biographical Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
120.title: "Vincent, Frida, Alberto et les Autres"
120.author: Thierry Groensteen
120.appears_in: p. 110-111 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 9 (Oct. 2003).
notes: Reviews three biographies in comics format: Vincent et Van Gogh (Gradimir Smudja) ; Frida Kahlo, une Biographie Surréelle (Marco Corona) ; Alberto G. (Éric Lambé & Philippe de Pierpont), the latter about Alberto Giacometti.

122.heading: Biographical Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Miscellanea.
122.title: "Non-Red Asia to Hear of American Heroes." Associated Press item in the Los Angeles Times, Dec. 20, 1949.
122.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: The U.S. State Department is sending comic-book biographies of George Washington, et al., to South Korea, Thailand, Vietnam, and Indonesia. "Wording is in the native languages."

123.heading: Biographical Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Miscellanea.
123.title: "Princess Diana Comic Slips Through the Cracks : Topps Comic Raises Questions about Diamond Policy Regarding Unauthorized Biographies"
123.author: Greg Stump
123.appears_in: p. 10-12 in The Comics Journal, no. 201 (Jan. 1998)

124.heading: Biographical Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Miscellanea.
124.title: "Publishing Groups Announce 'Classic' Series" p. 40-41 in The Comics Journal, no. 264
124.author: [No author]
notes: Rosen Publishing Group and Penguin USA will do biographies and literary adaptations respectively.
